subject: Improving build dependency to libtzplatform-config
commitMessage:
Improving build dependency to libtzplatform-config

Replacement of the hard coded version of the library with
a dynamic version computed from pkg-config.

Change-Id: Ic89537ed70c537cb13bfe12dc37f27817594f353
Signed-off-by: José Bollo <jose.bollo@open.eurogiciel.org>

subject: Make dlog use only systemd-journal.
commitMessage:
Make dlog use only systemd-journal.

Remove unnecessary binaries and scripts, change implementation
in order to make dlog use only systemd-journal.

Change-Id: Ia4dc41f444a041d7b1ea4c6e1d1bed8828814b81

subject: Don't expose systemd libraries via pkg-config Libs
commitMessage:
Don't expose systemd libraries via pkg-config Libs

pkg-config 'Libs:' specifies link flags specific to this package. However,
systemd journal logging is an internal dependency to libdlog. Therefore, it
is not needed to expose the dependency to libdlog users.

Change-Id: I3e6fe65b1d25c241032a5ecb4e972822340fcdae
Signed-off-by: Mikko Ylinen <mikko.ylinen@intel.com>

- Package: dlog
- Reviewer: tgraydon
- Comments: ok
- Git project: platform/core/system/dlog
- Tag:submit/tizen/20131104.210036
- Commit: 7125136fabfd0b9f1a508ee49ca45b851b3ce9be Dont expose systemd libraries via pkg-config Libs
- Request URL:https://build.tizen.org/request/show/16729

Patch Set 1:

I am not sure this is a good commit. It seems the linker is able to resolve the dependency. On the other hand "pkg-config --libs gtk+-3.0" prints a host of different libraries.

  -lgtk-3 -lgdk-3 -latk-1.0 -lgio-2.0 -lpangocairo-1.0 -lgdk_pixbuf-2.0 -lcairo-gobject -lpango-1.0 -lcairo -lgobject-2.0 -lglib-2.0

Patch Set 1:

Would you be able to explain the problem?

Patch Set 1:

When you build a gtk programme using pkg-config, you get quite a number of libraries to link against, even though you could link only against gtk and let the dynamic linker would do all the work. I thought it is done by putting the internal dependencies in the Libs filed and I was worried this patch would break something. I was wrong. There is quite lengthy Requires filed in the gtk+-3.0.pc file which holds gtk's internal dependencies.

My conclusion as of now is that libsystemd-journal should be a part of Requires filed of dlog.pc.in

Patch Set 1:

Requires.private perhaps?

Patch Set 1:

Definitely.

       Requires.private:
              A list of packages required by this package. The difference from
              Requires is that the packages listed under Requires.private  are
              not  taken into account when a flag list is computed for dynami?
              cally linked executable (i.e., when --static was not specified).
              In  the  situation where each .pc file corresponds to a library,
              Requires.private shall be used exclusively to specify the depen?
              dencies between the libraries.

pkg-config(1) man page.

Patch Set 1:

To be honest I thought about moving libsystem* to Requires.private but ended up sending this patch after all.

I can send a new patch to add Requires.private.

subject: Add an RPM build config to select libdlog backend
commitMessage:
Add an RPM build config to select libdlog backend

Use RPM build options to select libdlog output destination.

By default, Android logger driver is used. If the build config option is
set, systemd journal backend is selected instead.

Change-Id: Ief38c9b8f1c6e2d51a72257fea6290d0d2f4c23d
Signed-off-by: Mikko Ylinen <mikko.ylinen@intel.com>

subject: Fix path for systemd services

owner.name: Baptiste (DO NOT USE) DURAND (DO NOT USE)

commitMessage:
Fix path for systemd services

-> use %{_unitdir} instead of %{_libdir}/systemd/system
systemd services should be in /usr/lib/systemd instead of /usr/lib64/systemd
